Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD erred in determining the applicant did not face a personal risk upon return to El Salvador
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, section 97
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed specific threats from Maras Salvatruchas gang in El Salvador; was targeted multiple times
Court_Ruling: Application allowed; RPD decision set aside; case referred for redetermination
Defendant_Behavior: Maras Salvatruchas gang issued specific threats and targeted the applicant repeatedly
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution by a criminal gang in El Salvador
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review based on patent unreasonableness standard
Evidence_Used: Applicant's testimony regarding specific threats and targeting by gang
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Basis: Risk to life or cruel and unusual treatment if returned
Evidence_Assessed: Specific incidents of targeting by gang
Governing_Rule: Individual must prove personal risk on balance of probabilities
Evidentiary_Deficiency: RPD failed to properly assess personal nature of risk
Outcome: RPD decision overturned; case remitted for redetermination
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm from gang violence in El Salvador
Cause_Description: Applicant feared persecution by Maras Salvatruchas gang in El Salvador
Evidence_Handling: RPD dismissed claim as generalized; court found failure to recognize specificity of threats
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient consideration of evidence showing targeted threats
Legal_Provision: Section 97, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Assessment: Threats were specific and repeated, contrary to RPD's generalized risk finding
Decision_Rationale: Manifest unreasonableness in dismissing personal risk based on specific targeting
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to distinguish between generalized and personal risk
